{{EngvarB|date=August 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=December 2018}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Jordan Hugill | image = Jordan Hugill.jpg | caption = Hugill with Preston North End in 2016 | fullname = Jordan Thomas Hugill{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=18 February 2018}} | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=y|1992|06|04}} | birth_place = [[Middlesbrough]], England | height = {{height|ft=6|in=0}}{{cite web |title=Player Profile |url=http://mobile.pnefc.net/team/player-profile/jordan-hugill/25 |website=mobile.pnefc.net |accessdate=2 October 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161011081207/http://mobile.pnefc.net/team/player-profile/jordan-hugill/25|archive-date=11 October 2016|dead-url=yes}} | position = [[Forward (association football)|Forward]] | currentclub = [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]]
(on loan from [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]]) | clubnumber = 11 | youthyears1 = 2007–2008| youthclubs1 = [[Marske United F.C.|Marske United]] | years1 = 2008–2009| clubs1 = [[Seaham Red Star F.C.|Seaham Red Star]] | caps1 = | goals1 = | years2 = 2009–2010| clubs2 = [[Consett A.F.C.|Consett]] | caps2 = | goals2 = | years3 = 2011 | clubs3 = [[Jerez Industrial CF|Jerez Industrial]] | caps3 = | goals3 = | years4 = 2011–2012| clubs4 = [[Whitby Town F.C.|Whitby Town]] | caps4 = | goals4 = | years5 = 2012 | clubs5 = → [[Marske United F.C.|Marske United]] (loan) | caps5 = | goals5 = | years6 = 2013–2014| clubs6 = [[Port Vale F.C.|Port Vale]] | caps6 = 20 | goals6 = 4 | years7 = 2013 | clubs7 = → [[Gateshead F.C.|Gateshead]] (loan) | caps7 = 7 | goals7 = 5 | years8 = 2014–2018| clubs8 = [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]] | caps8 = 103 | goals8 = 23 | years9 = 2015 | clubs9 = → [[Tranmere Rovers F.C.|Tranmere Rovers]] (loan) | caps9 = 6 | goals9 = 1 | years10 = 2015 | clubs10= → [[Hartlepool United F.C.|Hartlepool United]] (loan)| caps10= 8 | goals10= 4 | years11 = 2018– | clubs11= [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] | caps11= 3 | goals11= 0 | years12 = 2018– | clubs12= → [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] (loan) | caps12= 28 | goals12= 6 | club-update = 17:00, 2 March 2019 (UTC) }} '''Jordan Thomas Hugill''' (born 4 June 1992) is an English professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)|forward]] for [[EFL Championship]] side [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]], on loan from [[Premier League]] club [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]]. A relative late comer to the professional game, he had spells with non-league sides [[Seaham Red Star F.C.|Seaham Red Star]], [[Consett A.F.C.|Consett]], [[Whitby Town F.C.|Whitby Town]] and [[Marske United F.C.|Marske United]], and also spent time at the then [[Glenn Hoddle Academy]] club [[Jerez Industrial CF|Jerez Industrial]] in Spain. He was signed by [[Port Vale F.C.|Port Vale]] in June 2013, and made his debut for the club four months later following a productive loan spell at [[Gateshead F.C.|Gateshead]]. He signed with [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]] in June 2014. He was loaned out to [[Tranmere Rovers F.C.|Tranmere Rovers]] in February 2015 and then [[Hartlepool United F.C.|Hartlepool United]] the following month. He was signed by Premier League side West Ham United in January 2018 for an undisclosed fee. He returned to the Championship the following transfer window in a season-long loan to Middlesbrough. ==Playing career== ===Early career=== Hugill, who was a pupil at [[Nunthorpe Academy|Nunthorpe School]],{{Cite web |title=From pulling pints at the Dickens Inn to scoring at the Riverside |last=Shaw |first=Dominic |work=Gazette Live |date=27 August 2014 |accessdate=20 June 2018 |url=https://www.gazettelive.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/dickens-inn-scoring-riverside-ex-7677911}} attended [[George Smith (footballer born 1945)|George Smith]]'s academy in [[Hemlington]] from the age of nine. He began his career with [[Northern Football League|Northern League]] club [[Seaham Red Star F.C.|Seaham Red Star]] at the age of 16, and was due to go on trial at [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] before he was struck down with an ankle injury in September 2009.{{cite news |title=Hugill injury blow for Red Star |url=http://www.sunderlandecho.com/sport/local-football-hugill-injury-blow-for-red-star-1-1070606 |accessdate=23 October 2013 |newspaper=Sunderland Echo |date=18 September 2009}} He later moved on to [[Consett A.F.C.|Consett]], but left his contract in August 2010 to spend two years at the [[Glenn Hoddle Academy]] in Spain.{{cite news |last=Woodcock |first=Laura |title=Jordan's off to train in Spain; ...with Glenn Hoddle! |url=http://www.thefreelibrary.com/Jordan%27s+off+to+train+in+Spain%3B+...with+Glenn+Hoddle!-a0234920253 |accessdate=23 October 2013 |newspaper=Evening Gazette |date=19 August 2010}}{{cite web |title=Marske United Make 2 New Signings |url=http://www.marskeunitedfc.com/news.htm |work=marskeunitedfc.com |accessdate=23 October 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131009024831/http://marskeunitedfc.com/news.htm |archivedate=9 October 2013 |df=}} He signed with [[Whitby Town F.C.|Whitby Town]] in December 2011 and scored in his debut game against [[Nantwich Town F.C.|Nantwich Town]], only to damage his anterior cruciate ligament later in the match and spend the next ten months out injured. He joined [[Marske United F.C.|Marske United]] in October 2012 initially on loan so as to regain match fitness. His last appearance for Marske came in the final of the [[North Riding Senior Cup]], where they were beaten 3–0 by [[Pickering Town F.C.|Pickering Town]].{{cite news |last=Steel |first=Adam |title=Cup final loss is story of Marske United's season |url=http://www.gazettelive.co.uk/sport/other-sport/amateur-sport/cup-final-loss-story-marske-3664998 |accessdate=23 October 2013 |newspaper=gazettelive.co.uk |date=1 May 2013}} During his time at the club he worked as a barman at the ''Dickens Inn'' in [[Middlesbrough]].{{cite news |title=Jordan Hugill determined to be a star |url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Port-Vale-Hugill-determined-Vale-star/story-20097666-detail/story.html |accessdate=19 November 2013 |newspaper=[[The Sentinel (Staffordshire)|The Sentinel]] |date=19 November 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131121032546/http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Port-Vale-Hugill-determined-Vale-star/story-20097666-detail/story.html|archive-date=21 November 2013|dead-url=yes}} ===Port Vale=== Hugill signed with [[EFL League One|League One]] club [[Port Vale F.C.|Port Vale]] in June 2013.{{cite news |title=Port Vale complete Chris Robertson and Gavin Tomlin deals |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23082437 |accessdate=23 October 2013 |newspaper=[[BBC Sport]] |date=27 June 2013}} He was loaned out to [[Gateshead F.C.|Gateshead]] of the [[Conference Premier]] on 20 September 2013.{{cite news |last=Baggaley |first=Mike |title=Vale striker joins Gateshead |url=http://www.thisisstaffordshire.co.uk/Vale-striker-joins-Gateshead/story-19825034-detail/story.html#axzz2fNPmF6cX |accessdate=20 September 2013 |newspaper=[[The Sentinel (Staffordshire)|The Sentinel]] |date=20 September 2013}} "Tynesiders" boss [[Gary Mills (footballer born 1961)|Gary Mills]] stated that Hugill was a "talented... goalscorer" and put him in the starting line-up for the next match.{{cite web |last=Bowron |first=Jeff |title=Gateshead Bring in Rams And Vale Pair |url=http://www.gateshead-fc.com/4606/gateshead-bring-in-rams-and-vale-pair |work=gateshead-fc.com |accessdate=23 October 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130925093727/http://www.gateshead-fc.com/4606/gateshead-bring-in-rams-and-vale-pair |archivedate=25 September 2013 |df=}} He scored his first goal for the club on 24 September in a 3–2 win over [[Chester F.C.|Chester]] at the [[Gateshead International Stadium]].{{cite news |title=Gateshead 3 – 2 Chester |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/24122084 |accessdate=23 October 2013 |newspaper=[[BBC Sport]] |date=24 September 2013}} He finished his loan spell with five goals in four starts and three substitute appearances. He made his debut for the "Valiants" on 22 October, and played the first 75 minutes of a 3–0 victory over [[Crawley Town F.C.|Crawley Town]].{{cite news |title=Crawley 0 – 3 Port Vale |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/24529456 |accessdate=23 October 2013 |newspaper=[[BBC Sport]] |date=22 October 2013}} He performed well on his debut, justifying his manager's surprise decision to play him alongside fellow Glenn Hoddle Academy graduate [[Ben Williamson (footballer)|Ben Williamson]] in place of established strikers [[Tom Pope]] and [[Lee Hughes]].{{cite news |last=Baggaley |first=Michael |title=Match report: Crawley Town 0, Port Vale 3 |url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Match-report-Crawley-Town-0-Port-Vale-3/story-19970607-detail/story.html |accessdate=23 October 2013 |newspaper=[[The Sentinel (Staffordshire)|The Sentinel]] |date=23 October 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131029213432/http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Match-report-Crawley-Town-0-Port-Vale-3/story-19970607-detail/story.html|archive-date=29 October 2013|dead-url=yes}} {{Quote|First of all you have to say well done to our chief scout, [[George Foster (footballer)|George Foster]], who spotted his potential playing in non-league. We had him with us last season and the one thing he struggled with was his fitness. Pre-season was a struggle for him as well. He is a big old boy, not used to a professional pre-season, but is one of those lads who never gives up. You ask him to pull out of things and he doesn't want to do that.|Port Vale manager [[Micky Adams]] describing Hugill in October 2013.{{cite news |title=Micky Adams salutes Port Vale heroes after Crawley win |url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Micky-Adams-salutes-Port-Vale-heroes-Crawley-win/story-19970609-detail/story.html |archive-url=https://archive.today/20131024020241/http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Micky-Adams-salutes-Port-Vale-heroes-Crawley-win/story-19970609-detail/story.html |dead-url=yes |archive-date=24 October 2013 |accessdate=23 October 2013 |newspaper=[[The Sentinel (Staffordshire)|The Sentinel]] |date=22 October 2013}}}} He scored his first Football League goal on 16 November, scoring the final goal of a 3–1 victory over [[Shrewsbury Town F.C.|Shrewsbury Town]] at [[Vale Park]]; after the match Adams said that the club had "unearthed a gem" in Hugill.{{cite news |last=Baggaley |first=Mike |title=Adams says Hugill is the real deal |url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Adams-says-Hugill-real-deal/story-20090264-detail/story.html |accessdate=16 November 2013 |newspaper=[[The Sentinel (Staffordshire)|The Sentinel]] |date=16 November 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131118214828/http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Adams-says-Hugill-real-deal/story-20090264-detail/story.html|archive-date=18 November 2013|dead-url=yes}} Hugill continued to turn out for the first team, but admitted that he needed to work on his fitness to play a full 90 minutes of professional football.{{cite news |title=Jordan Hugill determined to become Micky Adams' 90-minute man |url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Jordan-Hugill-determined-Port-Vale-s-90-minute/story-20632004-detail/story.html |accessdate=15 February 2014 |newspaper=[[The Sentinel (Staffordshire)|The Sentinel]] |date=15 February 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140303175246/http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Jordan-Hugill-determined-Port-Vale-s-90-minute/story-20632004-detail/story.html|archive-date=3 March 2014|dead-url=yes}} At the end of the [[2013–14 Port Vale F.C. season|2013–14]] campaign he was named as the club's Young Player of the Year, and also featured in Vale's [[Staffordshire Senior Cup]] final defeat to [[Rushall Olympic F.C.|Rushall Olympic]].{{cite news |last=Baggaley |first=Michael |title=Port Vale lose Staffs Senior Cup final to Rushall |url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Port-Vale-lose-Staffs-Senior-Cup-final-Rushall/story-21036812-detail/story.html |accessdate=11 May 2014 |newspaper=[[The Sentinel (Staffordshire)|The Sentinel]] |date=30 April 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140512221209/http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Port-Vale-lose-Staffs-Senior-Cup-final-Rushall/story-21036812-detail/story.html|archive-date=12 May 2014|dead-url=yes}}{{cite news |last=Baggaley |first=Mike |title=Tom Pope named Port Vale player of the year |url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Tom-Pope-named-Port-Vale-player-year/story-21056123-detail/story.html |accessdate=5 May 2014 |newspaper=[[The Sentinel (Staffordshire)|The Sentinel]] |date=5 May 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140505201838/http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Tom-Pope-named-Port-Vale-player-year/story-21056123-detail/story.html|archive-date=5 May 2014|dead-url=yes}} However, in the summer Micky Adams confirmed that Hugill had rejected the club's offer of a new contract, and stated: "It is disappointing ... we spent a lot of time and effort with Jordan last season, but we will have to accept it."{{cite news |title=Port Vale set to lose Jordan Hugill |url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Port-Vale-set-lose-Jordan-Hugill/story-21229649-detail/story.html |accessdate=13 June 2014 |work=t |date=13 June 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140616000211/http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Port-Vale-set-lose-Jordan-Hugill/story-21229649-detail/story.html|archive-date=16 June 2014|dead-url=yes}} ===Preston North End=== Hugill signed a two-year contract with League One club [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]] in June 2014, who paid Port Vale an undisclosed fee; manager [[Simon Grayson]] stated that "he's young, he's raring to go, hungry, he's a strong, powerful player, and he's got many attributes that will help us along the way this season and complement the squad well".{{cite web |title=Jordan Hugill: Preston North End sign Port Vale striker |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27930265 |accessdate=20 June 2014 |newspaper=[[BBC Sport]] |date=19 June 2014}} He had an eventful match after coming on for [[Andrew Little (footballer)|Andrew Little]] as a 20th-minute substitute at [[Walsall F.C.|Walsall]] on 13 September; he provided an assist for [[Joe Garner]] before being sent off for clashing with opposition defender [[Andy Butler]], he also picked up an injury in the game that required surgery and a lengthy spell on the sidelines.{{cite news |title=PNE striker undergoes knee surgery |url=http://www.lep.co.uk/sport/preston-north-end-news/pne-striker-undergoes-knee-surgery-1-6848320 |accessdate=7 October 2014 |work=Lancashire Evening Post |date=18 September 2014}} He returned to fitness in February 2015, at which point he joined his former Vale manager [[Micky Adams]] at [[EFL League Two|League Two]] side [[Tranmere Rovers F.C.|Tranmere Rovers]] for a one-month loan spell.{{cite news |title=Jordan Hugill: Preston North End striker loaned to Tranmere |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31658059 |accessdate=26 March 2015 |work=[[BBC Sport]] |date=27 February 2015}} On 26 March 2015, loan deadline day, Hugill signed for bottom-placed League Two club [[Hartlepool United F.C.|Hartlepool United]] on loan until the end of [[2014–15 Hartlepool United F.C. season|the season]]; "Pools" boss [[Ronnie Moore]] said that "It just didn't work at Tranmere. But we've seen a lot of him and he'll go straight in and get goals for us, no doubt about it".{{cite news |title=Hartlepool United: Preston striker Jordan Hugill signs on loan |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32064983 |accessdate=27 March 2015 |work=[[BBC Sport]] |date=26 March 2015}} He scored four goals in eight games for the club, including the winning goal against [[Exeter City F.C.|Exeter City]] at [[Victoria Park (Hartlepool)|Victoria Park]] that secured Pools' place in the [[English Football League]].{{cite news |last1=Mennear |first1=Richard |title=Hartlepool hero Jordan Hugill eyes Preston success but hasn’t ruled out a return to The Vic |url=http://www.hartlepoolmail.co.uk/sport/football/hartlepool-utd/hartlepool-hero-jordan-hugill-eyes-preston-success-but-hasn-t-ruled-out-a-return-to-the-vic-1-7234194 |accessdate=8 May 2015 |work=Hartlepool Mail |date=29 April 2015}} He was an unused substitute at [[Wembley Stadium|Wembley]] in the [[2015 Football League One play-off Final|play-off final]] as Preston won promotion into the [[EFL Championship|Championship]].{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/32770740 |title=Preston North End 4–0 Swindon Town |first=Nathan |last=Middleton |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 May 2015 |accessdate=26 December 2018}} He signed a new two-and-a-half-year contract in October 2015.{{cite news |title=Jordan Hugill: Preston North End striker signs new deal |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34541222 |accessdate=17 October 2015 |work=[[BBC Sport]] |date=15 October 2015}} He ended the [[2015–16 Preston North End F.C. season|2015–16]] campaign with five goals in 32 games. He continued to impress in the [[2016–17 Preston North End F.C. season|2016–17]] season, and was given another new two-and-a-half-year contract in September 2016.{{cite news |title=Jordan Hugill Signs New Contract |url=http://www.pnefc.net/news/article/2016-17/jordan-hugill-signs-new-contract-3308037.aspx |accessdate=12 January 2017 |work=pnefc.net |date=14 September 2016}} The club rejected an offer of £1.5 million from [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]] in January 2017.{{cite news |title=Jordan Hugill: Preston North End turn down Ipswich Town approach |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38594277 |accessdate=12 January 2017 |work=BBC Sport |date=12 January 2017}} He ended the [[2016–17 Preston North End F.C. season|2016–17]] season with 13 goals in 47 appearances to end up as Preston's top-scorer.{{cite news |last1=Seddon |first1=Dave |title=PNE striker on the radar of Championship rivals |url=http://www.lep.co.uk/sport/football/preston-north-end/pne-striker-on-the-radar-of-championship-rivals-1-8536589 |accessdate=12 May 2017 |work=Lancashire Post |date=11 May 2017 |language=en}} He started the [[2017–18 Preston North End F.C. season|2017–18]] season in good form and was linked with a number of clubs in the [[List of English football transfers summer 2017|summer transfer window]], and handed in a transfer request on 29 August.{{cite news |title=Preston striker Jordan Hugill hands in transfer request |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11697/11011344/preston-striker-jordan-hugill-hands-in-transfer-request |accessdate=29 August 2017 |work=Sky Sports |date=29 August 2017 |language=en}} ===West Ham United=== On 31 January 2018, Hugill completed a deadline day signing for [[Premier League]] club [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] in a reported £10 million transfer deal, becoming manager [[David Moyes]]' second signing at the [[London Stadium]].{{cite news |title=Jordan Hugill: West Ham sign Preston striker in reported £10m deal |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42895867 |accessdate=1 February 2018 |work=BBC Sport |date=31 January 2018}} However he was restricted to a handful of brief cameos in the second half of the [[2017–18 West Ham United F.C. season|2017–18]] season, playing just 22 minutes in total.{{cite news |last1=Inkersole |first1=Sam |title=Jordan Hugill – Why his West Ham career is yet to take off |url=https://www.football.london/west-ham-united-fc/players/jordan-hugill-west-ham-future-14484202 |accessdate=11 May 2018 |work=footballlondon |date=6 April 2018}}{{cite news |last1=Inkersole |first1=Sam |title=Why Jordan Hugill was not named in the West Ham squad to face Everton |url=https://www.football.london/west-ham-united-fc/players/jordan-hugill-west-ham-everton-14651777 |accessdate=14 May 2018 |work=footballlondon |date=13 May 2018}} ====Middlesbrough loan==== On 8 August 2018, Hugill returned to the Championship on a season-long loan to [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]].{{cite news |title=Jordan Hugill joins Middlesbrough on loan from West Ham |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11680/11465611/jordan-hugill-closing-in-on-middlesbrough-loan-move-as-west-ham-enter-talks |accessdate=8 August 2018 |work=Sky Sports |date=8 August 2018 |language=en}} ==Style of play== Hugill is a target man [[Forward (association football)|forward]], has great strength and is able to out-muscle opposition defenders.{{cite news |last1=Baggaley |first1=Mike |title=Tom Pope: Why former Port Vale striker Jordan Hugill is in demand |url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/tom-pope-why-former-port-vale-striker-jordan-hugill-is-in-demand/story-30054123-detail/story.html |accessdate=13 January 2017 |work=Stoke Sentinel |date=13 January 2017}}{{Dead link|date=November 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}{{cite news |title=Ice-cool striker Jordan Hugill gives manager Micky Adams food for thought |url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Port-Vale-Ice-cool-striker-Jordan-Hugill-gives/story-19985687-detail/story.html |accessdate=25 October 2013 |newspaper=[[The Sentinel (Staffordshire)|The Sentinel]] |date=25 October 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131029210253/http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/Port-Vale-Ice-cool-striker-Jordan-Hugill-gives/story-19985687-detail/story.html|archive-date=29 October 2013|dead-url=yes}} Former Port Vale teammate [[Tom Pope]] stated that Hugill had an excellent attitude and "was desperate to learn and improve".{{cite news |last1=Pope |first1=Tom |title=Deadline day paid off for Jordan Hugill and Louis Dodds, by Port Vale's Tom Pope |url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/sport/football/deadline-day-paid-jordan-hugill-1154256 |accessdate=2 February 2018 |work=Stoke Sentinel |date=2 February 2018}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 23 February 2019}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |+ Appearances and goals by club, season and competition |- !rowspan="2"|Club !rowspan="2"|Season !colspan="3"|League !colspan="2"|[[FA Cup]] !colspan="2"|[[EFL Cup|League Cup]] !colspan="2"|Other !colspan="2"|Total |- season|id=72606|season=2013|accessdate=1 January 2017}} |[[EFL League One|League One]] |20||4||4||1||0||0||0||0||24||5 |- ||[[Gateshead F.C.|Gateshead]] (loan) |[[2013–14 Gateshead F.C. season|2013–14]] |[[National League (division)|Conference Premier]] |7||5||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||7||5 |- |rowspan="5"|[[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]] |[[2014–15 Preston North End F.C. season|2014–15]]{{Soccerbase season|id=72606|season=2014|accessdate=1 January 2017}} |League One |3||0||0||0||2||1||1{{efn|Appearance in the [[EFL Trophy|League Trophy]]}}||1||6||2 |- |[[2015–16 Preston North End F.C. season|2015–16]]{{Soccerbase season|id=72606|season=2015|accessdate=1 January 2017}} |[[EFL Championship|Championship]] |29||3||1||0||2||2||colspan="2"|—||32||5 |- |[[2016–17 Preston North End F.C. season|2016–17]]{{Soccerbase season|id=72606|season=2016|accessdate=1 January 2017}} |Championship |44||12||1||0||2||1||colspan="2"|—||47||13 |- |[[2017–18 Preston North End F.C. season|2017–18]]{{Soccerbase season|id=72606|season=2017|accessdate=1 January 2017}} |Championship |27||8||1||0||1||2||colspan="2"|—||29||10 |- !colspan="2"|Total !103!!23!!3!!0!!7!!6!!1!!1!!114!!30 |- |[[Tranmere Rovers F.C.|Tranmere Rovers]] (loan) |[[2014–15 Tranmere Rovers F.C. season|2014–15]] |[[EFL League Two|League Two]] |6||1||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||6||1 |- |[[Hartlepool United F.C.|Hartlepool United]] (loan) |[[2014–15 Hartlepool United F.C. season|2014–15]] |League Two |8||4||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||8||4 |- |rowspan="2"|[[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] |[[2017–18 West Ham United F.C. season|2017–18]] |[[Premier League]] |3||0||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||3||0 |- !colspan="2"|Total !3!!0!!0!!0!!0!!0!!0!!0!!3!!0 |- |[[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] (loan) |[[2018–19 Middlesbrough F.C.
